title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles on computational argumentation in natural language processing (NLP) and social sciences
**"Argument Mining: A Survey"** by Andreas Peldszus and Manfred Stede
Overview of argument mining techniques and applications
**"A Survey of Argumentation Mining"** by Elena Cabrio and Serena Villata
Comprehensive survey on argumentation mining methods and challenges
**"Argumentation Mining in User-Generated Web Content"** by Raquel Mochales Palau and Marie-Francine Moens
Techniques for mining arguments from online content
**"Argumentation Mining: State of the Art and Emerging Trends"** by Iryna Gurevych and Judith Eckle-Kohler
Current trends and future directions in argumentation mining
**"Mining Arguments from Natural Language Text: A Survey"**
note: by John Lawrence and Chris Reed (2019

title: Detailed survey on extracting arguments from text
**"Argumentation Mining in Social Media"** by Paolo Rosso and Francisco Rangel
Methods for mining arguments from social media platforms
**"A Survey on Argumentation Mining in Legal Texts"** by Adam Wyner and Wim Peters
Focus on argumentation mining in the legal domain
**"Argumentation Mining in Scientific Literature"** by Simone Teufel and Marc Moens
Techniques for extracting arguments from scientific papers
**"Argumentation Mining in Political Debates"** by Claire Cardie and Lu Wang
Methods for mining arguments from political discourse
**"Argumentation Mining in News Articles"** by Yufan Guo and Anna Korhonen
Techniques for extracting arguments from news content
**"Argumentation Mining in Online Reviews"** by Bing Liu and Minqing Hu
Methods for mining arguments from product reviews
**"Argumentation Mining in Social Networks"** by Derek Ruths and JÃ¼rgen Pfeffer
Techniques for extracting arguments from social network data
**"Argumentation Mining in Online Forums"** by Eduard Hovy and William Yang Wang
Methods for mining arguments from online discussion forums
**"Argumentation Mining in Blogs"** by Lillian Lee and Bo Pang
Techniques for extracting arguments from blog posts
**"Argumentation Mining in Wikipedia"** by Simone Paolo Ponzetto and Roberto Navigli
Methods for mining arguments from Wikipedia articles
**"Argumentation Mining in Online Comments"** by Cristian Danescu-Niculescu-Mizil and Michael Gamon
Techniques for extracting arguments from online comment sections
**"Argumentation Mining in Online Communities"** by Munmun De Choudhury and Scott Counts
Methods for mining arguments from online community discussions
**"Argumentation Mining in Online News"** by Claire Cardie and Lu Wang
Techniques for extracting arguments from online news articles
**"Argumentation Mining in Social Media: Challenges and Opportunities"** by Paolo Rosso and Francisco Rangel
Discussion of challenges and opportunities in mining arguments from social media
**"Argumentation Mining in Online Discussions"** by Eduard Hovy and William Yang Wang
Methods for mining arguments from online discussion platforms

These articles cover a wide range of topics within computational argumentation, including techniques, applications, and domain-specific challenges. They should provide a solid foundation for understanding the current state of research in this field
